task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 8°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full facade from ground to roofline to estimate the building’s height, so I should tilt the view upward while staying facing north.
The upper portion/roofline is visible but I still need a better sense of total height from ground to roof, so I should tilt down to include the base while keeping the top in frame.
With most of the facade in view, I can now estimate height by counting apparent stories and typical floor-to-floor height, so I should stop and report the estimate.
